intro: Clavija pendula, commonly known as the weeping clavija, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its pendulous, hairy stems that bear clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Clavija pendula is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique, cascading growth habit.
